description: Root family encompassing all Indo-European languages
The Sino-Tibetan language family, the world's second-largest by number of speakers
A large family of languages spoken primarily in Africa and the Middle East, comprising six major branches

eastSemitic.note: Extinct languages, included for historical completeness

omotic.note: Classification of Omotic as a branch of Afro-Asiatic is debated; sometimes considered independent

egyptian.note: Extinct branch; included for historical and linguistic completeness
